formalpara.title: Figure 5. Regulation of LET-60/Ras by GEFs and GAPs
formalpara.para: Ras GTPase regulation by GEFs and GAPs has been extensively studied in other systems (Malumbres and Barbacid, 2002). The GEF SOS-1 has widespread requirements in LET-60/Ras signaling (Chang et al., 2000). The alternative RGEF-1 is used in AWC (Chen et al., 2011). There are three C. elegans GAP proteins that show varying tissue specificity and function in a semi-redundant manner (Stetak et al., 2008).
